name: description.txt
prompt:
Generate HTML with vtk.js to visualize volume rendering

Load from http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti
Compute and render velocity magnitude

Use vtkFullScreenRenderWindow
Load vtk.js from CDN
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
    <script>
        // Required VTK modules for volume rendering
        const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
        const vtkHttpDataSetReader = vtk.IO.Core.vtkHttpDataSetReader;
        const vtkVolume = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkVolume;
        const vtkVolumeMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkVolumeMapper;
        const vtkColorTransferFunction = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkColorTransferFunction;
        const vtkPiecewiseFunction = vtk.Common.DataModel.vtkPiecewiseFunction;

        // Create full screen render window
        const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance({ background: [0, 0, 0] });
        const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
        const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

        // Load dataset from URL
        const reader = vtkHttpDataSetReader.newInstance({ fetchGzip: true });
        reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti').then(() => {
            reader.loadData().then(() => {
                // Get the output data which is the volume data
                const volumeData = reader.getOutputData();

                // Create volume mapper
                const volumeMapper = vtkVolumeMapper.newInstance();
                volumeMapper.setInputData(volumeData);

                // Create color and opacity transfer functions for volume rendering
                const ctfun = vtkColorTransferFunction.newInstance();
                ctfun.addRGBPoint(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
                ctfun.addRGBPoint(64.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
                ctfun.addRGBPoint(128.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
                ctfun.addRGBPoint(192.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0);
                ctfun.addRGBPoint(255.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0);

                const ofun = vtkPiecewiseFunction.newInstance();
                ofun.addPoint(0.0, 0.0);
                ofun.addPoint(64.0, 0.0);
                ofun.addPoint(128.0, 0.3);
                ofun.addPoint(192.0, 0.6);
                ofun.addPoint(255.0, 0.8);

                // Create volume actor and set properties
                const volume = vtkVolume.newInstance();
                volume.setMapper(volumeMapper);
                volume.getProperty().setRGBTransferFunction(ctfun);
                volume.getProperty().setScalarOpacity(ofun);
                volume.getProperty().setInterpolationTypeToLinear();

                // Add volume to renderer and render
                renderer.addVolume(volume);
                renderer.resetCamera();
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

                const imageData = reader.getOutputData();

                // Create volume mapper
                const volumeMapper = vtkVolumeMapper.newInstance();
                volumeMapper.setInputData(imageData);

                // Create color transfer function
                const cfun = vtkColorTransferFunction.newInstance();
                cfun.addRGBPoint(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
                cfun.addRGBPoint(64.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
                cfun.addRGBPoint(128.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
                cfun.addRGBPoint(192.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0);
                cfun.addRGBPoint(255.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.0);

                // Create opacity transfer function
                const ofun = vtkPiecewiseFunction.newInstance();
                ofun.addPoint(0.0, 0.0);
                ofun.addPoint(64.0, 0.2);
                ofun.addPoint(128.0, 0.4);
                ofun.addPoint(192.0, 0.6);
                ofun.addPoint(255.0, 0.8);

                // Create volume
                const volume = vtkVolume.newInstance();
                volume.setMapper(volumeMapper);
                volume.getProperty().setRGBTransferFunction(cfun);
                volume.getProperty().setScalarOpacity(ofun);

                // Add volume to renderer
                renderer.addVolume(volume);
                renderer.resetCamera();
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>

</html>

name: description.txt
prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the rotor dataset.

- Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti
- Set the active scalar array to "Pressure".
- Apply a slice along the Y axis at 95% depth of the dataset (convert percentage to slice index).
- Use a blue → white → red color map for pressure values, spanning from the minimum to maximum scalar range.
- Set opacity to fully opaque (no transparency variation).
- Add an orientation marker with XYZ axes in the bottom-right corner.
- No interactive GUI controls are required.
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <title>Rotor Dataset Visualization</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
    <script>
        // Main modules needed
        const vtkHttpDataSetReader = vtk.IO.Core.vtkHttpDataSetReader;
        const vtkImageSlice = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkImageSlice;
        const vtkImageMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkImageMapper;
        const vtkColorTransferFunction = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkColorTransferFunction;
        const vtkPiecewiseFunction = vtk.Common.DataModel.vtkPiecewiseFunction;
        const vtkOrientationMarkerWidget = vtk.Interaction.Widgets.vtkOrientationMarkerWidget;
        const vtkAxesActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkAxesActor;
        const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;

        // Create full screen render window
        const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance();
        const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
        const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

        // Create orientation marker (axes)
        const axes = vtkAxesActor.newInstance();
        const orientationWidget = vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.newInstance({
            actor: axes,
            interactor: renderWindow.getInteractor(),
        });
        orientationWidget.setViewportCorner(vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.Corners.BOTTOM_RIGHT);
        orientationWidget.setEnabled(true);
        orientationWidget.setInteractive(false);

        // Load dataset from local server
        const reader = vtkHttpDataSetReader.newInstance({ fetchGzip: true });
        reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti').then(() => {
            reader.loadData().then(() => {
                const imageData = reader.getOutputData(0);

                // Set active scalar to "Pressure"
                imageData.getPointData().setActiveScalars('Pressure');
                const pressureArray = imageData.getPointData().getScalars();
                const [minVal, maxVal] = pressureArray.getRange();

                // Compute slice index at 95% depth along Y axis
                const dims = imageData.getDimensions(); // [x, y, z]
                const sliceIndexY = Math.floor(0.95 * (dims[1] - 1));

                // Create color transfer function: blue -> white -> red
                const ctf = vtkColorTransferFunction.newInstance();
                ctf.addRGBPoint(minVal, 0, 0, 1);      // Blue
                ctf.addRGBPoint((minVal + maxVal) / 2, 1, 1, 1); // White
                ctf.addRGBPoint(maxVal, 1, 0, 0);      // Red

                // Create opacity function (fully opaque)
                const ofun = vtkPiecewiseFunction.newInstance();
                ofun.addPoint(minVal, 1.0);
                ofun.addPoint(maxVal, 1.0);

                // Create mapper and actor for image slice
                const mapper = vtkImageMapper.newInstance();
                mapper.setInputData(imageData);
                mapper.setSliceAtY(sliceIndexY); // Slice along Y at computed index
                mapper.setScalarRange(minVal, maxVal);
                mapper.setColorLevel((minVal + maxVal) / 2);
                mapper.setColorWindow(maxVal - minVal);

                const actor = vtkImageSlice.newInstance();
                actor.setMapper(mapper);
                actor.getProperty().setRGBTransferFunction(0, ctf);
                actor.getProperty().setScalarOpacity(0, ofun);
                actor.getProperty().setUseLookupTableScalarRange(true);

                // Add actor to renderer
                renderer.addActor(actor);
                renderer.resetCamera();
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

name: description.txt
prompt:
Generate HTML with vtk.js to visualize volume rendering

Load from http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/airfoil_oneslice.vtp
Scalar Mapping:
Activates the p scalar array for color encoding
Visualization:
Renders the colors and representation
positions the camera to focus on the dataset bounds
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>vtk.js Volume Rendering from VTP</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
    <script>
        // Since the dataset is a VTP (polydata) file and not a volume (ImageData),
        // true volume rendering (with vtkVolume) is not applicable.
        // Instead, we will render the polydata surface with color mapped from the 'p' scalar array.

        const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
        const vtkXMLPolyDataReader = vtk.IO.XML.vtkXMLPolyDataReader;
        const vtkActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkActor;
        const vtkMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkMapper;

        // Create full screen renderer
        const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance();
        const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
        const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

        // Create reader for VTP file
        const reader = vtkXMLPolyDataReader.newInstance();
        reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/airfoil_oneslice.vtp').then(() => {
            reader.loadData().then(() => {
                const polyData = reader.getOutputData(0);

                // Ensure the 'p' scalar array is active for color mapping
                const pointData = polyData.getPointData();
                const pArray = pointData.getArray('p');
                if (pArray) {
                    pointData.setScalars(pArray);
                }

                // Create mapper and actor
                const mapper = vtkMapper.newInstance();
                mapper.setInputData(polyData);
                mapper.setScalarVisibility(true); // Enable color mapping based on scalars

                const actor = vtkActor.newInstance();
                actor.setMapper(mapper);

                // Add actor to renderer
                renderer.addActor(actor);
                renderer.resetCamera(); // Position camera to focus on dataset bounds
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

prompt:
Generate HTML with vtk.js to visualize volume rendering

Load from http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/airfoil_oneslice.vtp
Scalar Mapping:
Activates the p scalar array for color encoding
Visualization:
Renders the colors and representation
positions the camera to focus on the dataset bounds
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>vtk.js Volume Rendering from VTP</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
    <script>
        // Load required modules
        const vtkHttpDataSetReader = vtk.IO.Core.vtkHttpDataSetReader;
        const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
        const vtkActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkActor;
        const vtkMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkMapper;

        // Force loading of HttpDataAccessHelper for gzip support if needed
        const vtkHttpDataAccessHelper = vtk.IO.Core.DataAccessHelper.HttpDataAccessHelper;

        // Create full screen render window
        const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance();
        const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
        const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

        // Set up reader to load VTP file from local server
        const reader = vtkHttpDataSetReader.newInstance({ fetchGzip: true });
        reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/airfoil_oneslice.vtp').then(() => {
            reader.loadData().then(() => {
                const polydata = reader.getOutputData(0);

                // Ensure the 'p' scalar array is active for color mapping
                const pointData = polydata.getPointData();
                const pArray = pointData.getArray('p');
                if (pArray) {
                    pointData.setScalars(pArray);
                } else {
                    console.warn("Scalar array 'p' not found in dataset.");
                }

                // Create mapper and actor
                const mapper = vtkMapper.newInstance();
                mapper.setInputData(polydata);

                const actor = vtkActor.newInstance();
                actor.setMapper(mapper);

                // Add actor to scene
                renderer.addActor(actor);
                renderer.resetCamera(); // Automatically positions camera to focus on dataset bounds
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>vtk.js Volume Rendering from VTP</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
    <script>
        // Load required modules
        const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
        const vtkXMLPolyDataReader = vtk.IO.XML.vtkXMLPolyDataReader;
        const vtkActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkActor;
        const vtkMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkMapper;

        // Create full screen render window
        const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance({ background: [0, 0, 0] });
        const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
        const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

        // Initialize reader for VTP file
        const reader = vtkXMLPolyDataReader.newInstance();

        // Set URL to local dataset and process after loading
        reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/airfoil_oneslice.vtp').then(() => {
            reader.loadData().then(() => {
                const polyData = reader.getOutputData(0);

                // Ensure the 'p' scalar array is active for color mapping
                const pointData = polyData.getPointData();
                pointData.setActiveScalars('p');

                // Create mapper and actor
                const mapper = vtkMapper.newInstance();
                mapper.setInputData(polyData);
                mapper.setScalarVisibility(true); // Enable color mapping based on scalars

                const actor = vtkActor.newInstance();
                actor.setMapper(mapper);

                // Add actor to renderer
                renderer.addActor(actor);

                // Reset camera to focus on dataset bounds
                renderer.resetCamera();
                renderWindow.render();
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

name: description.txt
prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Deepwater dataset with isosurface rendering.

Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti

Compute velocity magnitude from arrays v02 and v03

Generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range

Use a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)

Set the isosurface to fully opaque with smooth shading

Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corne
generator_prompt:
Please use vtkjs to generate visualization code. The code should be in the form of a complete code wrapped only in HTML tags. Please add your thinking process as comments in the code to make it easier to understand the code logic.

In the code, use `<script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>` as the library for visualization to implement the visualization function.
Please follow the following rules:
1. The content of the answer is HTML code with vtkjs script(start from <!DOCTYPE html>), and if there is any explanation, it should be given in the form of comments.
2. If the sample code is relevant to the user's requirements, implement the user's requirements based on the sample code.
3. The answer should be based on the provided sample information, and do not fabricate functions that do not exist. 
Please implement the code strictly according to the specific requirements of the user in the `<QUESTION></QUESTION>` tag. Ensure that the code logic is clear and straightforward, and generate the visualization-related code completely in accordance with the syntax specifications of vtkjs. 
<QUESTION>__QUESTION__</QUESTION>
evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>
evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.8</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements most of the visualization pipeline but uses vtkContourFilter instead of vtkImageMarchingCubes, and has a simpler color transfer function with fewer points.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>The visual output should be similar, though the color mapping is less refined with fewer gradient points. The isosurface may look slightly different due to the different algorithm used.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The code is well-structured and follows vtk.js best practices, with clear variable naming. Some elements could be more complete to match the ground truth exactly.</Reason>
    </Dimension>

        <OverallScore>0.85</OverallScore>

    </Summary>
</Evaluation>
analysis:
Data Loading — Load the dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Data Processing — Compute velocity magnitude from arrays 'v02' and 'v03' using vtkCalculator with a mathematical expression such as 'sqrt(v02*v02 + v03*v03)' to create a new scalar field.
Isosurface Generation — Use vtkImageMarchingCubes to generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range (i.e., (min + max)/2) from the computed velocity magnitude.
Color Mapping — Apply a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range using vtkColorTransferFunction, linked to the mapper for the isosurface.
Surface Properties — Set the isosurface to fully opaque with smooth shading by configuring the mapper's interpolation to 'Gouraud' and opacity to 1.0.
UI Components — Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corner using vtkOutlineFilter on the dataset and a corresponding actor to visualize spatial axes.
Rendering — Configure the render window, renderer, and interactor to display the scene with proper camera setup and interaction controls.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>

        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>

analysis:
Data Loading — Load the dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataWriter.
Data Processing — Compute velocity magnitude from the 'velocity' array using vtkCalculator and set it as the active scalar.
Visualization Setup — Apply volume rendering using vtkVolumeMapper and vtkVolumeActor with a color map spanning from blue to white to red, derived from the scalar range (min to max).
Opacity Control — Define a piecewise opacity function using vtkPiecewiseFunction to control transparency across scalar values.
Shading Properties — Set shading, ambient, diffuse, and specular properties on the volume actor for realistic appearance.
Camera Configuration — Adjust the camera to look along the +Z axis and center on the dataset using vtkRenderer.

analysis.description: Load the .vti dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader and set 'velocity' as the active vector field.
Create 1000 random seed points within the dataset bounds using vtkPointSource to serve as streamline starting positions.
Use vtkStreamTracer with Runge-Kutta 4 integration, 1000 maximum steps, to trace streamlines from the seed points through the velocity field.
Generate a bounding box outline of the dataset using vtkOutlineFilter for spatial context.
Map the streamline polydata to an actor with cyan color and line width 1 using vtkPolyDataMapper and vtkActor.
Map the outline geometry to an actor with red color and line width 3 using vtkPolyDataMapper and vtkActor.
Initialize vtkFullScreenRenderWindow, add both streamline and outline actors to the renderer, and render without UI controls.

prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the rotor dataset.

- Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti
- Set the active scalar array to "Pressure".
- Apply a slice along the Y axis at 95% depth of the dataset (convert percentage to slice index).
- Use a blue → white → red color map for pressure values, spanning from the minimum to maximum scalar range.
- Set opacity to fully opaque (no transparency variation).
- Add an orientation marker with XYZ axes in the bottom-right corner.
- No interactive GUI controls are required.

Set 'Pressure' as the active scalar array. Compute slice index at 95% depth along Y-axis and apply vtkImageSlice to extract that slice.

Initialize render window, renderer, and interactor. Add slice actor and orientation marker. Render the final scene without GUI controls.

name: description.txt
prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Redsea dataset with volume rendering.

Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti

Compute velocity magnitude from the "velocity" array and set it as the active scalar

Apply volume rendering using a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)

Apply a piecewise opacity function to control transparency across scalar values

Set shading, ambient, diffuse, and specular properties for realistic volume appearance

Adjust the camera to look along +Z and center on the dataset
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8" />
  <title>Redsea Volume Rendering - vtk.js</title>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
</head>
<body>
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js"></script>
  <script>
    const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
    const vtkHttpDataSetReader = vtk.IO.Core.vtkHttpDataSetReader;
    const vtkVolume = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkVolume;
    const vtkVolumeMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkVolumeMapper;
    const vtkColorTransferFunction = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkColorTransferFunction;
    const vtkPiecewiseFunction = vtk.Common.DataModel.vtkPiecewiseFunction;
    const vtkDataArray = vtk.Common.Core.vtkDataArray;

    const fullScreenRenderWindow = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance({
      background: [0, 0, 0],
    });
    const renderer = fullScreenRenderWindow.getRenderer();
    const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderWindow.getRenderWindow();

    const reader = vtkHttpDataSetReader.newInstance();

    reader.setUrl('http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti', { loadData: true }).then(() => {
      const imageData = reader.getOutputData();

      // Compute velocity magnitude from "velocity" array
      const pd = imageData.getPointData();
      let velocityArray = pd.getArrayByName('velocity') || pd.getVectors();
      if (!velocityArray) {
        console.error('Velocity array not found.');
        return;
      }
      const comp = velocityArray.getNumberOfComponents();
      const vData = velocityArray.getData();
      const tuples = vData.length / comp;

      const magValues = new Float32Array(tuples);
      for (let i = 0; i < tuples; i++) {
        const x = vData[i * comp + 0] || 0;
        const y = vData[i * comp + 1] || 0;
        const z = vData[i * comp + 2] || 0;
        magValues[i] = Math.sqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z);
      }

      const magArray = vtkDataArray.newInstance({
        name: 'velocity_magnitude',
        numberOfComponents: 1,
        values: magValues,
      });

      // Set magnitude as active scalars
      pd.setScalars(magArray);
      imageData.modified();

      // Create transfer functions using data range
      const [minV, maxV] = magArray.getRange();
      const midV = (minV + maxV) / 2;

      const cfun = vtkColorTransferFunction.newInstance();
      cfun.addRGBPoint(minV, 0, 0, 1); // blue at min
      cfun.addRGBPoint(midV, 1, 1, 1); // white at mid
      cfun.addRGBPoint(maxV, 1, 0, 0); // red at max

      const ofun = vtkPiecewiseFunction.newInstance();
      ofun.addPoint(minV, 0.0);
      ofun.addPoint(midV, 0.3);
      ofun.addPoint(maxV, 1.0);

      // Volume mapper and actor
      const mapper = vtkVolumeMapper.newInstance();
      mapper.setInputData(imageData);

      const spacing = imageData.getSpacing();
      const minSpacing = Math.min(spacing[0], spacing[1], spacing[2]);
      mapper.setSampleDistance(0.7 * minSpacing);
      mapper.setComputeNormalFromOpacity(true);

      const volume = vtkVolume.newInstance();
      volume.setMapper(mapper);

      const prop = volume.getProperty();
      prop.setRGBTransferFunction(0, cfun);
      prop.setScalarOpacity(0, ofun);
      prop.setInterpolationTypeToLinear();
      prop.setShade(true);
      prop.setAmbient(0.2);
      prop.setDiffuse(0.7);
      prop.setSpecular(0.3);
      prop.setSpecularPower(10.0);

      renderer.addVolume(volume);

      // Camera: look along +Z and center on dataset
      const bounds = imageData.getBounds();
      const center = [
        0.5 * (bounds[0] + bounds[1]),
        0.5 * (bounds[2] + bounds[3]),
        0.5 * (bounds[4] + bounds[5]),
      ];
      const dx = bounds[1] - bounds[0];
      const dy = bounds[3] - bounds[2];
      const dz = bounds[5] - bounds[4];
      const diag = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz) || 1.0;

      const cam = renderer.getActiveCamera();
      cam.setFocalPoint(center[0], center[1], center[2]);
      cam.setPosition(center[0], center[1], center[2] + diag);
      cam.setViewUp(0, 1, 0);

      renderer.resetCameraClippingRange();
      renderWindow.render();
    });
  </script>
</body>
</html>

name: ground_truth.html
prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Deepwater dataset with isosurface rendering.

Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti

Compute velocity magnitude from arrays v02 and v03

Generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range

Use a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)

Set the isosurface to fully opaque with smooth shading

Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corne
generated_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>Deepwater Isosurface - vtk.js</title>
  <style>
    html, body {
      margin: 0;
      padding: 0;
      width: 100%;
      height: 100%;
      overflow: hidden;
      background: #202020;
    }
  </style>
</head>

<body>
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@32.6.0/vtk.js"></script>
  <script>
    // vtk aliases
    const vtkFullScreenRenderWindow = vtk.Rendering.Misc.vtkFullScreenRenderWindow;
    const vtkXMLImageDataReader = vtk.IO.XML.vtkXMLImageDataReader;
    const vtkCalculator = vtk.Filters.General.vtkCalculator;
    const vtkImageMarchingCubes = vtk.Filters.General.vtkImageMarchingCubes;
    const vtkMapper = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkMapper;
    const vtkActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkActor;
    const vtkColorTransferFunction = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkColorTransferFunction;
    const vtkAxesActor = vtk.Rendering.Core.vtkAxesActor;
    const vtkOrientationMarkerWidget = vtk.Interaction.Widgets.vtkOrientationMarkerWidget;

    const AttributeTypes = vtk.Common.DataModel.vtkDataSetAttributes.AttributeTypes;
    const FieldDataTypes = vtk.Common.DataModel.vtkDataSet.FieldAssociations;

    // Renderer setup
    const fullScreenRenderer = vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance({
      background: [0.12, 0.12, 0.12],
    });
    const renderer = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderer();
    const renderWindow = fullScreenRenderer.getRenderWindow();

    // Reader
    const reader = vtkXMLImageDataReader.newInstance();

    const url = 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti';

    reader.setUrl(url, { loadData: true }).then(() => {
      // Calculator to compute velocity magnitude from v02 and v03
      const calculator = vtkCalculator.newInstance();
      calculator.setFormula({
        getArrays: (inputDataSets) => ({
          input: [
            { location: FieldDataTypes.POINT, name: 'v02' },
            { location: FieldDataTypes.POINT, name: 'v03' },
          ],
          output: [
            {
              location: FieldDataTypes.POINT,
              name: 'velocityMagnitude',
              dataType: 'Float32Array',
              numberOfComponents: 1,
              attribute: AttributeTypes.SCALARS,
            },
          ],
        }),
        evaluate: (arraysIn, arraysOut) => {
          const [v02, v03] = arraysIn.map((a) => a.getData());
          const [velMag] = arraysOut.map((a) => a.getData());
          const n = velMag.length;
          for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            const u = v02[i];
            const v = v03[i];
            velMag[i] = Math.sqrt(u * u + v * v);
          }
          arraysOut.forEach((x) => x.modified());
        },
      });

      calculator.setInputConnection(reader.getOutputPort());
      calculator.update();

      const imageDataWithVel = calculator.getOutputData();
      const scalars = imageDataWithVel.getPointData().getScalars();
      const [sMin, sMax] = scalars.getRange();
      const sMid = 0.5 * (sMin + sMax);

      // Isosurface via marching cubes at mid scalar value
      const mCubes = vtkImageMarchingCubes.newInstance();
      mCubes.setComputeNormals(true);
      mCubes.setInputConnection(calculator.getOutputPort());
      mCubes.setContourValue(sMid);

      // Mapper and actor
      const mapper = vtkMapper.newInstance();
      mapper.setInputConnection(mCubes.getOutputPort());
      mapper.setScalarVisibility(true);
      mapper.setScalarModeToUsePointFieldData();
      mapper.setColorByArrayName('velocityMagnitude');
      mapper.setScalarRange(sMin, sMax);

      // Color transfer function: blue -> white -> red
      const cfun = vtkColorTransferFunction.newInstance();
      cfun.addRGBPoint(sMin, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
      cfun.addRGBPoint(sMid, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0);
      cfun.addRGBPoint(sMax, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
      mapper.setLookupTable(cfun);

      const actor = vtkActor.newInstance();
      actor.setMapper(mapper);
      actor.getProperty().setOpacity(1.0);
      actor.getProperty().setInterpolationToPhong();

      renderer.addActor(actor);
      renderer.resetCamera();

      // Orientation marker (XYZ axes) bottom-right
      const axes = vtkAxesActor.newInstance();
      const omw = vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.newInstance({
        actor: axes,
        interactor: fullScreenRenderer.getInteractor(),
      });
      omw.setEnabled(true);
      omw.setViewportCorner(vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.Corners.BOTTOM_RIGHT);
      omw.setViewportSize(0.15);
      omw.setMinPixelSize(100);

      renderWindow.render();
    });
  </script>
</body>

</html>
